title: Magic constant
summary: The magic constant or magic sum of a magic square is the sum of numbers in any row, column, or diagonal of the magic square. For example, the magic square shown below has a magic constant of 15. For a normal magic square of order n – that is, a magic square which contains the numbers 1, 2, ..., n2 – the magic constant is M = n ⋅ n 2 + 1 2 {\displaystyle M=n\cdot {\frac {n^{2}+1}{2}}} .
